ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Put together a thesis plan for my senior essay through discussion with my advisor. Compiled a bibliography of sources for my thesis topic, and a plan for writing over the winter break and the spring semester.

I learned how to write a long philosophy paper for myself. I had never written anything close to this length, and wording have understood what thats supposed to look like if not for this course. Theres a completely different level of expectation about organization and taking into account objections that I learned to meet through this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Would be helpful to have access to former senior theses in philosophy, to read work produced by other students in the past.

I loved how much freedom I had on length, topic, etc. the feedback and advice I got was also excellent. I think that it would have been nicer if departmental expectations were a bit clearer, and if there was a deadline for a draft.

I personally would have loved some more support, engagement, or structure from the philosophy department. It would be great if there was a sense of community cultivated by the department so that seniors could help and learn from each other.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if they love philosophy and are passionate about conducting independent research.

Yes! I am so glad I did this. It was incredibly rewarding to get to work on a project that was entirely my own, and the feedback I got from professors in the philosophy department really helped me develop my own thoughts on the topic.
